Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, great little hotel!”
Reviews.Author: TonySands
Reviews.Content: First off, when I'm on a city break, I like to spend most of my time/evenings in an "Old Town" type area, with local bars & restaurants where locals go to. If this is the sort of thing you look for in a city break, then Trastevere in Rome is where you want to stay. If that's the case, then this hotel is absolutely spot on! Trastevere is full of locals eating and drinking good quality products at fair prices, none of this plastic multi-lingual nonsense you will get in the touristy parts of Rome. Location wise, it's smack in the middle of Trastevere, with all the main bars/restaurants within a 5-10 minute walk. It's also only 10-15 minutes from the Piazza Navona where most of the tourist attractions are based. Vatican is a ~30 minute walk if you fancy a stroll through such a beautiful city, although buses are readily available. Ruins and Colosseum are equally about 30 minutes eastwards. Pretty easy to get to this hotel from the airport, get a train (local, not express) to Trastevere station and then get a tram towards the centre. The "staff" (probably the most human people I've ever seen working at a hotel) at this hotel are incredibly friendly and accomodating. I'm a pretty cynical person and treat any kind of recommendations with skepticism, but all the recommendations the hotel gave us in terms of restaurants and bars were spot on! They also pointed things out on a map we could take with us which was used more than the guide book maps we had. This hotel is effectively an apartment converted into 5 rooms and a kitchen, and although the staff are only there until ~6:30pm, you have keys so no worries about staying out late. Upon arrival, there was the legendary carafe of red wine on our bed, which was very quickly consumed after a day at the vatican! The room we had was very basic (Blue Room), but the beds were possibly the most comfortable I've ever slept in, had A/C, were very quiet, free wifi, and a laptop with internet. If you're visiting Rome, you won't spend much time in your hotel, so anymore in your room would be wasted in my opinion. Just a kitchen with a fridge, but there is an Espresso machine that is free to use, and the hotel provide you with tokens to have a Coffee+Pastry+Juice at a lovely cafe around the corner (also a nice bar in the evening!). To sum up, if I were to visit Rome again, I wouldn't hesitate to stay in this hotel again as it was perfect for our needs, extremely accomodating, and very reasonably priced.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: thebearandclaire
Reviews.Content: The accommodation was very good & the service superb. On check in, we received a complementary carafe of red wine which was delightful & got us in the mood for a lovely weekend in an amazing city. It is located next within walking distance of all the major sites & Maria the owner of the guest house couldn't have been more helpful in helping us plan our assault on the city. She also recommend some fine restaurants which we dined in during our stay. Overall, I would say excellent & would definitely stay here again!!!

Reviews.Title: “Super nice place to stay :)”
Reviews.Author: trippin123134
Reviews.Content: Booked via booking.com. Their website looks really good but had some "what if" s- definitely no need! This place doesn t have a regular reception- they called us asking about arr time. Was no prob with check in. The room we stayed was a blue-ish one ( can check from pics on website)- nice furnitured, small but cozy and comfortable. Clean and modern but tiny bathroom was more than enough for two people :) Very good location- not exactly on the main noisy street bt a bit on the back side of. A short walk distance to the heart of Trastevere was a great base for night life.Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “A great value guest house-all you need when sightseeing in Rome”
Reviews.Author: jrnewb
Reviews.Content: We have just returned a stay at WRH Trastevere. Their website and the "excellent" and "very good" comments on Tripadvisor sum up this place pretty well. It is spotlessly clean, the beds are comfortable and it is quiet{at least for a city}. There isn't a bar but there are fridges if you want to bring something back, You are only a short distance from the bars and restaurants of Trastevere. Maria and Fabrizio are great hosts and made us feel particularly welcome.They gave really helpful advice on whatever we needed. Trastevere is a great location and only a short walk from "Ancient Rome". This guest house /boutique hotel is all you really need if you are out most of the time exploring Rome. On a practical note it is cheaper and quicker to catch the local train from FCO airport and then catch a number 8 tram, rather than travel by the express train into the centre and then out. We thoroughly recommend WRH Trastevere

Reviews.Title: “Everything I expected and exactly what I wanted”
Reviews.Author: Mike596
Reviews.Content: Fantastic little hotel. The staff are super helpful to your needs and the location is excellent for getting out and walking about. I stayed there in June 2011 with my wife and promised I would write a review as way of thanks to Maria and Fabrizio. Look at the website and what you see is what you get. Something a little different and a little special. Loved the hotel, the staff and Trastevere and Roma.

Reviews.Title: “Exactly the type of accommodation I look for when traveling”
Reviews.Author: amyakabetty
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in early December 2011 and thought this place was a great value. We booked online for three nights, and ended up staying for an additional three nights. We stayed in two different rooms (the Marilyn Monroe room and a slightly smaller room with a canopy bed that was as awesome in its own way). The rooms are all decorated uniquely, but both were exceptionally clean and bright. There are flat screen televisions, free wi-fi, and a laptop computer in each room. The location was excellent. Trastevere is a cute, vibrant neighborhood that has tons of shops and restaurants. Best of all, Trastevere doesn't feel touristy but it isn't far from all of the tourist attractions. It is an easy walk to the Pantheon and other sites across the Tiber River, and when we didn't feel like walking, we hopped on the #8 Tram or a bus, both within a 3-5 minute walk from the guesthouse. It was very easy to get here from the airport using public transport (a combination of a train to the Trastevere station, and then the #8 Tram towards Argentina). All of this, and I didn't even mention the best part - Maria and Fabrizio were extremely friendly and helpful. They gave us many tips about our stay, ranging from how to get from point a to point b, how to get bubble wrap to wrap up our olive oil and wine to take home, storing our luggage while we took a side trip to Naples, opening hours for stores, best views of Rome, and many recommendations of places to eat. All of their tips and directions were spot on, and really made for a great stay. I can't wait to go back to Rome, and I absolutely would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “WRH Trastevere”
Reviews.Author: Matt P
Reviews.Content: We came to this hotel December 2007 and loved everything about it. We chose the Marilyn Monroe Room, and this was the best decision. The room was bright, large and comfortable. Although we are at the front of the building, this was mostly quiet as the building is actually just behind the main road. You get a laptop in your room with free wifi and if you have a wifi enabled device the passcode is in the room ready for you to use. We returned December 2011 again chose the same room and still not disappointed. The hotel had changed hands and some changes had taken place – for example the fridge that is still in your room no longer works, however this was not an issue for us as we where out all day. As the hotel is room only with no restaurant attached you are provided with breakfast at a local café, this included a pastry, hot drink and cold – This became an experience rather than the normal breakfast feeling you get. We were welcomed warmly with a hot and cold drink, shown our room and to our surprise a bottle of wine and biscuits left on our bed. As always the hotel was extremely clean and quiet. The staff are polite extremely knowledgeable and always happy to help with any needs we had. This included information on where to eat and booking it for us. We had wonderful food and drink whilst here and if you like your food, history or architecture you will not be disappointed. The hotel is 25minute walk to the coliseum 50minutes to the Vatican and all other areas no further – in my opinion although you will be tired at the end of the day it is worth walking everywhere as you do see more on foot. Trams pass on your door step frequently (every 10mins or so) buses can be picked up and taxi’s near by if required. Don’t bother looking for other areas/hotels to stay WRH Trastevere is a wonderful hotel in a fantastic location and you will not be disappointed. Book Now! xx

Reviews.Title: “Home Sweet Rome”
Reviews.Author: dillardr
Reviews.Content: After much too much research for a place to stay in Rome, my Wife and I decided on WRH for a 7 night stay during Thankgiving week in November.. We could not have asked for a better experience. Easy email communication, Maria sent a very informative email with suggestions and an offer to help anything we needed. Easy train/tram ride from FCO airport. Love the neighborhood and we were welcomed by Alex and Maria. The room was clean, quiet and we felt very comfortable and given plenty of privacy. Fabrizio, Alex and Maria were always willing to answer any questions and help with anything needed. Fabrizio went online to help me with soccer tickets, which is not as easy as in US. We are now Juventus fans, sorry Alex and Farrizio. Maybe next time we can go to a ROMA match. When closing the window, is was so quiet that we did not even need the ear plugs we brought. Plenty of towels, modern bathroom, room serviced every day, comfortable bed, free wi fi and even had a laptop in room. The breakfast included was at Bar Lelly, right across the street and this was a great way to start the day. The guys there were so nice and new what we wanted each day. The location could not be beat, great area for walking and eating. THe # 8 tram will be your new friend, You will not regret staying here and I hope one day we can return to Rome one day and will look forward to staying at WRH again. Thanks

Reviews.Title: “You'll be pleasantly surprised in more than one way...”
Reviews.Author: EdmondUK
Reviews.Content: Service: you can count on Maria and Fabrizio to give you impartial tips on places to eat and visit which your guidebooks might not. They're also always on hand to help with booking restaurant or museum/gallery tickets, which we found really handy given our Italian is non-existent. Value: for the location, service and size of room, I really cannot imagine finding anywhere comparable to be cheaper in Rome. Sleep quality: the communal area (the reception, kitchen and library) is adjacent to all the rooms so you might get slightly disturbed if you're a light sleeper. Cleanliness: room is serviced daily so no complaints here at all. Location: now this wins the day for me. Being on the west bank of River Tiber, Trastevere is markedly less touristy than Tridente, Monti and Centro Storico. Instead of monied locals and eateries/bars that cater for them, you get a youngish, local crowd who enjoys general merriments at local pubs/bistros off the main piazzas. Cafes and supermarkets can be found within 5 minutes walk. For first timers in Rome, a gentle 20 stroll will take you to the Roman Forum and Colosseum; taxi to the Vatican costs less than 10 euros; catch a tram from the main road right by the hotel, and you will be in Piazza Navona and Pantheon within 10 minutes. Room: quirky but functional. The laptop is a good idea on paper but sadly it does not work properly so care to bring your own. Wifi is free and reliable which is worth a mention! Things to be to aware of: 1) the hotel is located in an old building that looks rather unpromising with a rather small sign of the hotel so do look hard! That said, Maria or her colleagues will send you a very detailed email with various ways to get there; 2) there is no lift but only one flight of stairs to climb; 3) the reception is not manned 24/7 so don't lose your keys (one each for the front door of the building, door to enter the hotel and room, so it is rather secure!). My restaurants of choice are too many to mention here but you can't go wrong with these two: Lunch - you can pretty go anytime and have a good, hearty and well-priced meal at Capranica. Close to Pantheon. Dinner - Da Francesco. Go there. Expect to queue. Well worth it. Enjoy. Ciao!

Reviews.Title: “Best place I've ever stayed in Rome”
Reviews.Author: Larry F
Reviews.Content: WRH Trastevere is the perfect mixture of a hotel, a B&B and an apartment rental. Basically, it consists of several bedrooms on one floor of a small apartment building. There is one common room--with a kitchen where you can easily make your own delicious espresso--which I did first thing every morning. Fabrizio and Maria are perfect hosts, very sweet, very smart, very helpful and never intrusive. The fact that they are only there during the day makes the place feel more like your own--which wears well over a long stay. We stayed for 5 nights. The rooms are very minimal but function well. The location cannot be beat. One block off Viale Trastevere--the main artery through Trastevere, yet on a quiet side street. A few blocks from the Tiber and a bridge that crosses right into the Jewish Ghetto area--and all very convenient to Piazza Navona, Campo dei fiori, the Pantheon--and, going the other direction, Testaccio. Pizzeria Marmi is right around the corner, as is the best food in Rome (at Le Mani in Pasta). I've stayed in many places in Rome and this is a place I will certainly return to again. I look forward to it.

Reviews.Title: “Customer service excellence”
Reviews.Author: Evan H
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Rome in September 2011, and when we arrived at WRH Trastevere we were greeted warmly by our host Fabrizio. With a carafe of wine waiting for us in our room & after short rest Fabrizio was extremely helpful and advised us on the best sights to see & the restaurants to dine at. We highly recommend this accommodation as it's clean & fresh, extremely comfortable, so close to the major attractions with Maria & Fabrizio being fantastic hosts. We plan on returning in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Hospitality Fantastico!”
Reviews.Author: welovehappyholidays
Reviews.Content: I just knew from the moment I initially enquired about this accommodation it was going to be great. Well I was right. Booking was personal, professional and friendly. Your hosts are Maria and Fabrizio, plus a very efficient and friendly cleaner. They booked our airport transfers which were also efficient, friendly, hassle free with a very clean vehicle our driver was Jacamo. Please be clear this is not a 24 hour hotel with all the impersonal service normally associated with these establishments. The Bed and Breakfast/Apartment was exactly as it appeared on the website. It was welcoming, very clean and well planned. All rooms are en-suite. We had three rooms all had showers. I think there are five rooms altogether. All rooms had a laptop which easily connected to the internet, a safe, a hair-dryer, good sized towels, plenty of clothes hangers, air conditioning/heating and a fridge. The beds were very comfortable and we all slept well. If you needed a coffee or a hot drink there is a small kitchen for your use, with a complimentary selection of teas, coffees and milk. There is also a wide selection of reading material and guide books. You have your own keys and can come and go as you like. There are no restrictions on timings during your stay. If I were to be super critical I would have liked a large mirror in our bedroom (Marilyn room), But this is just incidental and nitpicking. It is within easy walking distance for most of Rome's major attractions and very near the Tiber. I think the nearest bridge was Ponte Garibaldi. There are numerous amounts of bars and eating places within steps from the building. Once we found our bearings we also discovered we were within very close walking distance to Ponte Cestio over the island Tiberna and there you have it, The Roman Forum, Palatine, Colosseum it's all there! Amazing. Maria and Fabrizio were there all day, just not in the evenings. But then why do you need someone in the evenings anyway? We felt very safe and the staff were not at all intrusive. They will help you with anything you need and answer any questions you may have. They give a very helpful street map of Rome. Recommend eating places that will suit your individual tastes. I suggest you take these recommendations they were by far the best out of the local eating places we tried. There is a friendly little bar at the end of the road where you can have a drink and wait for or meet the rest of your group. yes there is a little noise from other rooms/apartments but in reality not very much and I would be surprised if you could find anywhere completely quiet in a central location in Rome! All in all I thoroughly recommend this accommodation. Nothing is too much trouble for these wonderful hosts with their delightful accommodation. On a further note I was and still am, amazed at how friendly the majority of the Roman people were. This is most unusual for a Capital City. I hope I can go back soon there is still so much more to see. I loved Rome and the people. Thank you so much.

Reviews.Title: “A flawless hotel”
Reviews.Author: Flat6Inc
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I have just returned from a long weekend's stay at the WRH Trastevere. It is a brilliant little hotel/b&b and well worth a visit. We went for the superior room which was spacious and very comfortable, I would say it is worth the extra money. Maria and Fabrizio were extremely helpful. We were greeted with a bottle of wine and snacks which was very welcome after the flight. They know all the best restaurants (take their advice, trust me!), they are happy to book museums, reservations, taxis etc etc. You just wouldnt get this personal service at a major hotel and it made our stay so easy and trouble-free. Breakfast is across the street in an authentic coffee shop where you share the bar with dozens of locals popping in for a cappucino and a chat. This is a great touch! What we loved most about this little hotel is the fact that it feels like you have your own little apartment in the excellent Trastevere district. As you will see from a map Trastevere is so accessible for the rest of the city, we walked everywhere and this was the best way to really see the city. The bars and restaurants of Trastevere are very trendy and there is loads going on. All in all i would highly reccomend this hotel and we will definitely be staying there again on our next trip. Thanks very much Maria and Fabrizio!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location and people”
Reviews.Author: JH-H-aust
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay in this hotel, the area is wonderful and provides an endless choice for dining, you are also close to the major attractions in Rome. The people are fantastic, always ready to assist you with restaurant choices, tours, and travel instructions for public transport etc. They arranged our airport pick up which was top class. The only word of warning is that this is not a standard hotel with reception desk room service etc... Perhaps more a guest house than hotel so if you want those facilities perhaps this is not for you, also you do need to climb a flight of stairs to the first floor. I would recommed this hotel and this part of Rome to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Stay here, you won't regret it!”
Reviews.Author: Tohams
Reviews.Content: This place was amazing! The location was excellent, it was super clean, and above all, the staff and owners were so helpful. Even before our trip, they helped us plan our stay: not just at the hotel, but in Rome. We stayed in "The Marilyn." Great room: very spacious, an amazing bathroom (with a shower that I want in my house), a laptop with internet, access to their WiFi for my smart phone, etc. Next time I go to Rome on vacation, I'm definitely staying here!

Reviews.Title: “Will be back...”
Reviews.Author: Cup0Joe
Reviews.Content: This was our first stop on our month-long Italian adventure in May 2011, and we absolutely loved WRH Trastevere. It was recommended by a friend who stayed there the year prior, and I can see why. Fabrizio was extremely helpful and even booked our tours of the Vatican and Ancient Rome for us. The blue room (room 4, I believe) was a perfect place to call home for the 5 days we were there. And the location could not have been better as it seemed to be within walking distance to everything we wished to see, yet it still seemed nicely tucked out of the main tourist area. We will definitely be back.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it!”
Reviews.Author: AnaTReis
Reviews.Content: This is a small hotel (5 to 6 rooms, I think), so very quiet and cool. Owners were really nice, and beyond helpful. They welcomed us with a smile, gave us good indications on restaurants, public transportation, booked us online tickets so that we could save time, etc. The room was very clean, modern, with a huge bed. We had fresh flowers, wine and cookies to welcome us, which is a nice touch. The area is very convenient. You can walk everywhere if you want, although buses and tram stop close to the hotel. Also, Trastevere is full of restaurants and bars (we did not have any problems with noise, however), which is great, because after so much walking and sight-seeing during the day, we really didn't want to look far for restaurants. At WRH Trastevere you'll only need to cross the street and you'll have many choices available. I recommend this hotel to anyone visiting Rome and will definitely stay there again if ever in town.

Reviews.Title: “Like having your own apartment in Trastevere”
Reviews.Author: kpw60
Reviews.Content: Not a hotel at all, but your own room in an apartment block in Trastevere! Good size and nicely decorated with good air conditioning. Walking distance of more restaurants than you could possibly sample and walking distance of the centre of Rome (although you can get a tram right outside if you don't want to walk). Friendly but very unobtrusive service and advice from Maria especially. Really enjoyed the stay and would (and have already) recommend it to anyone visiting Rome. Only criticism: very small shower cubicle. Be careful or you will change the water temperature with your elbow.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent and very friendly helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: Griggster22
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a week with 2 teenagers, the room was very comfortable and clean and made up each day. On arrival we had chilled wine, friendly staff who could not do enough for us during our stay. They are very knowledgeable on things to do, how to get around bus numbers etc, booking attractions etc. You are close to the river, tram and buses. I would recomend the bus to get around as there is only 2 train lines. We walked most places and it was only 20 mins into most central rome sights, The hotel was a little difficult to find initially, the streets are narrow and one way, we parked within 50m and walked the final leg. The property is located in a quiet area and we all slept soundly. It has great facilities, nice shower a blessing after a hot Rome day, the common room with coffee maker and comfy chairs. There are good restaurants close by and we felt very safe walking around Travestere at night. I would recommend the private car if arriving or departing by plane. We had a terrific stay and would definately recommend this to friends as it was recommended to us and we were not disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommend - Beautiful Room & Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: yddib
Reviews.Content: Even before we arrived the correspondence with the staff through email was a pleasure. They emailed lots of tips about sight seeing in Rome and they were always willing to assist in anything we required. We booked a car to pick us up from the airport and bring us to the hotel. This was a great idea. We didn't have to worry about buses or taxis. There was someone waiting for us and brought us straight to the door of the hotel. We were early so we couldn't check in. We left our bags and had a stroll around Rome with the very helpful map they gave us. As previous reviewers have mentioned, breakfast is served just down the road so we didn't see this as an issue. We found it on our walk so that we would know where to go in the morning. It is located in a lovely quiet area and a good location to base ourselves. When we came back to check in our room was so clean and really pretty. The wifi is excellent. I would recommend this hotel to anyboday visiting Rome. It was a pleasure staying here and made our stay in Rome even more enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “Modern and hip , highly recommend for budget travelers .”
Reviews.Author: annkitty
Reviews.Content: Maria us such a great host , she gives good recommendation on sightseeing , places to eat and shop. This hotel is mordened , hip and clean . Well maintained . Kitchen is free to use and coffee are free. This place remind me of being home and the staff are very nice . Definatelt will go back and stay again especically for the location . Being a single woman traveler , safety is my main concern and this neighborhood is safe enough to walk around even at mid-night .

Reviews.Title: “If you want to be a little off the beaten path but feel comfortable and welcomed this is a great option.”
Reviews.Author: OurayChicago
Reviews.Content: We stayed for three nights in June. This is a great way to feel like you are getting a little more authentic view of Rome away from the crowds, but still have a very comfortable experience. The hotel is located in an apartment building on a little side street but easy walking distance from the major destinations in Rome. The owners are super helpful and nice. Our only issue was that the walls are thin and there was a baby next door. It wasn't a huge issue and the owners were very appologetic and worked with us to resolve. Overall, it was a great experience and a good value.

Reviews.Title: “Great, hotel, great neighborhood. Friendly owners”
Reviews.Author: BigEasy8009
Reviews.Content: A nice, clean, small hotel in the quite Trastevere area of Rome. Right off the Tram line which provides access to the Rome bus system. Breakfast is included at a small coffee shop a block away and includes a coffee, fresh squeezed juice and pastries. Probably the best cup of cappuccino we had the whole trip. The owner Fabrizio was extremely helpful with directions and dining recommendations. The rooms are air conditioned, very clean and were cleaned daily. A short 3 block walk will take you to the Piazza, Santa Maria en Trastevere which has a bunch of good restaurants and is a busy area in the evening. The hotel has a small kitchen area with a coffee and tea maker. The rooms are located on the second floor and didn't appear to have elevator access if that's an issue. Might be a bit hard to find as there is no sign on the building only the street number. Fabrizio lined up a reasonably priced van to take us to the airport on the day of our departure. Would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay again in a heartbeat”
Reviews.Author: Claire648
Reviews.Content: My family spent three nights at the WRH Trastevere in Rome in early June 2011 and would recommend it to anyone. It wasn't so easy to find accommodation for all four of us in one room, but the staff at WRH could not have been more helpful and kind. It's a lovely guesthouse tucked into an apartment building on a side street in Trastevere. Knowing nothing of Rome, we were so happy to have stayed across the river in this more quiet, more "regular" neighborhood. The free breakfast, provided at a cafe across the street, was lovely, and we got to eat with many locals outside on the terrace rather than in the typical communal dining room filled with other tourists. A great place to stay. Cannot recommend it highly enough.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic B&B in wonderful part of Rome!”
Reviews.Author: morriemoo
Reviews.Content: What a little treasure! This was such a find, and we found it through Trip Adviser! Dont be put off by the outside of the building or the front door (both rather daggy!) Situated in the 'old' character filled part of Rome south of the river, but in easy walking distance of all the sights (without being in the main 'tourist' hype). The interior is bright, modern and super clean and friendly. Staff available 9 to 5. Gorgeous room with ensuite bathroom and bar fridge.Bright common area with kitchenette providing coffee and teamaking etc. Extremely helpful staff communicated by email prior to our stay with travel and sightseeing information. Organised a car to pick us up at the airport for only 50 euros, a must after a long flight. Very reasonable tariff for B&B. Breakfast provided by coupon, in a cafe on the main street. Delicious fresh squeezed orangejuice, croissant and coffee to die for!! We would definitely stay here again if we visit Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: BoNry
Reviews.Content: Perfect in every way. Beautiful hotel, fantastic staff, perfect location and loved the breakfast at the local Italian bar. Wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “Very good location, very nice staff”
Reviews.Author: Alexis40
Reviews.Content: The location of the hotel is very good and the staff is very nice. We spent a very nice time at WRH Trastevere, it was an excellent base for visiting Rome!

Reviews.Title: “Can't figure out a better location”
Reviews.Author: jukala
Reviews.Content: Look at the map, plug the main spotsof the city then figure out that Trastevere is indeed such a lively place to enjoy in the evening (the tips for restaurants from Fabrizio are spot on). There is just everything you need and it looks informal. Very clean, warm when we were there and winter was still around. The cherry on the cake was actually Fabrizio offering me, when I arrived there, to drive my car to a parking place after quite a few hours driving from North and that famous amazing experience to drive in Rome (even with a GPS, getting to the hotel is an adventure on its own : believe what you read in the books : stay calm :-) ). Of course, these days, they are refitting the street and the noise from 6 a.m. is a catastrophy :-). But the hotel can't hardly do anything about it and, actually, ... don't you expect Rome to be a bit funky. I'm sure though that, under nomal circumstances, this is a quiet place. I'll get back there for SURE !

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, homely, luxuary, good price and perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Helena05958
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay at whr trastevere! The room was beautiful and warm (February), the bath was clean, we were welcomed with wine, juice and chocolade, the internet acess was perfect and the common area with free coffee and tea was very nice. Even if we arrived very late we were welcomed in a friendly way (after beeing brought to the hotel by the shuttle service). On the first morning we got a lot of tips of where to go and where to eat, and every request during our stay was attended to immedeately. It was very quiet and we slept very well in the luxuary beds. The location was more than perfect; in the homely Trastevere and with the city center very close by. The first days we just walked around; as the feet begun to hurt we went by tram and bus - both just around the corner. The breakfast in the nearby café was nice; the fridge in the room and the kitchen in the common area gives a good oppurtunity to make your own breakfast if you would not be satisfied with coffee/tea, fresh juice and a croissant (for us it was a good an italian style way of starting the days!). We would have been happy to stay longer than 5 days, just to eat at all the nice and genuin restaurants recommended by the friendly staff!

Reviews.Title: “A fantastic base to explore Rome”
Reviews.Author: EmmaT78
Reviews.Content: WRH Trastevere is a lovely hotel - the team who manage it could not be more helpful, the room was fantastic and we loved the location at the heart of bustling Trastevere. There are some great authentic Roman restaurants nearby and great nightlife too. I would highly recommend a stay here and we will definitely be back.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful room with extremely helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: comfytraveller12
Reviews.Content: What a lovely surprise to walk into our room and see flowers, a 4 poster bed and a bottle of local wine waiting for us. This hotel was excellent. The room was great (if the bed wasn't a little unsupportive and bendy in the middle) complete with free wifi and laptop in the room. Nicely furnished and with a high pressured shower, our stay was delightful. A big thank you to Maria and the team who offered excellent advice on places to eat in the area, places to go and how much time to allow to see everything. That made the world of difference. We didn't experience any issues with noise from other rooms as others have mentioned in their review, but we were there in the off season. Included breakfast was at a friendly local place across the road. Would highly recommend!

Reviews.Title: “A small hotel with fantastic service”
Reviews.Author: juviall
Reviews.Content: The location of the hotel and the staff are fantastic. Staff are friendly and helpful, especially with booking dinners and advising on sights. The free laptop in each room with unrestricted intenet access was phenomenal. The major drawback is that the hotel is small and the rooms are located immediately off the reception/lounge area, so it can be noisy. The bathrooms also are noisy. At times we heard people peeing in the other rooms! Overall, we recommend the hotel, but take earplugs.

Reviews.Title: “The owner and staff were very helpful and friendly. Great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: dimara4man
Reviews.Content: This place was a great place to stay because of its location, great attention from staff and owner, very cozy, comfortable, inexpensive and beautiful. The only bad thing that happened to us was that the owner recommended a hotel across the street "Relais Trastevere" that was not good. .

Reviews.Title: “Value for money, but a little noisy”
Reviews.Author: mandm71
Reviews.Content: Stayed here about a week ago.Location is great.The fact is in Rome you will need to do some walking regardless where you are located. Staff were helpful and suggested some great local restaurants. Rooms were big, loved looking out of our window. I liked the bed as it was ultra soft. Breakfast was great.I loved going into the little cafe to be greeted with smiles and lovely coffee. Now the only issue I had was with the noise late at night. The noise wasn't from the street, or the the local church, or anything outside, it was from the room next to us. I swear they rearranged the furniture 26 times before they were comfortable with their setup. After getting that right it was time for them to have a shower.....IT WAS LOUD. I don't know if we were unlucky and had temporary neighbors from he'll, but I slept very little that night. All in all it was quite a nice place to stay. Would I stay here again, probably not. I say this only because I would be happy to pay a bit more and maybe get something a little quieter.

Reviews.Title: “The Key to a good stay in Rome”
Reviews.Author: Nalle_Rufs
Reviews.Content: Me and my partner choose the WRH due to the reviews found here and we were most happy. The location, on a quiet street cloose to the night life area of Trastevere is perfect. The room was very cool and modern. Excellent suggestions from the staff to find great hidden restaurants where the locals go.

Reviews.Title: “Best place to stay in Rome”
Reviews.Author: kapnkool
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were in Rome from Oct 3 to Oct 6. They people that run this bed and breakfast were extremely nice and helpful. We arrived early in the morning so our room was not ready, Carl, the owner made us coffee and took the time to explain the area and give us dinner recommendations. The room was big by European standards with its own bathroom. The location is close to the tram and is within walking distance to many great bars and cafes.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Trastevere Area”
Reviews.Author: CynWhite
Reviews.Content: We recently took a 2-week trip to Italy with Rome being our first and last stops. Upon arriving at the airport, we were greeted by our driver arranged by the WRH Trastevere hotel. He zipped us from the airport through the city to our hotel. We never would have found the place without him. Our room was lovely. It was very large based on past big city experiences. We had the luxury of making our own coffee whenever we wanted it in the morning. For breakfast you could walk about 1/2 block for rolls, juice and coffee. If I would have realized that one could have access to a kitchen, I would have bought some cereal, fruit and milk. I'm not sure though that the rooms that were facing the kitchen were bothered by the noise. Our room was very quiet because it was set back. We loved the Trastevere area. We walked to the Forum and Colossium but spent our evenings in the Trastevere area. The best pizza in Rome is found right around the corner of our hotel. Also, prices for food and drink is much better here than in the touristy areas. An extra perk is that you have a laptop in your room!

Reviews.Title: “Modern base in a great location”
Reviews.Author: LLGreen
Reviews.Content: Our taxi driver (from Romecabs) found this hotel with no problems as he had used SATNAV, and I had printed out the location on Google Maps. We pressed the buzzer and were let in to climb one flight of stairs. Our room wasn't quite ready (we arrived around noon) so we were offered coffee and one of the staff sat us down and helped us with our plans for the day. When we go into our room we were pleased that it was light, airy and very clean. We slept wonderfully the whole week we were there. The staff gave us vouchers for breakfast at a lovely cafe on the main street in Trastevere. Trastevere is a fantastic place - full of cobbled streets, bars and restaurants. We took the staff's advice and went to a restaurant by the river called 'San Michele' - go there if you get the chance. All in all, I was very pleased with the hotel and would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Staff. An Exceptionally Clean and Comfortable Room”
Reviews.Author: DBR2010
Reviews.Content: The hotel seems to be a converted apartment. It has part-time receptionist coverage. The staff is wonderful. Special kudos to Maria, who helped us when our safe wouldn't open, and she had to come in early the next day with a key since we discovered this problem at 7 pm on a Friday after the person at the reception desk had gone home. Our room was spacious, and the beds are very comfortable. The room was also very clean. My only constructive suggestion to the staff is to kindly update the contact numbers that are left on the desk when no one is working at the hotel. But all in all, a nice place to stay in Trastevere, and I thank the wonderful staff at the hotel for all their help.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: pmmom
Reviews.Content: Pros: - Luigi was very nice and friendly. Helped us with our luggages up the 2 sets of stairs. We had three 25" and one 22". He carried two 25", each weighing about 30 lbs. Helped us with directions from point A to B. Recommended restaurants. He was not there when we checked out but we left a token gratuity for him. - Room was clean and good size for a family of 4. Bed were comfortable for us. We were at the Marilyn Monroe (red) room. It was room number 1. - Walking distance to Billa (grocery store), Ai Marmi (pizza place), Take (japanese), so we were all set. - Breakfast across the street. You get a croissant, a juice and a coffee. Very friendly. Only DH drank coffee, but they allowed the rest of us to have 2 juices instead. - A/C was sufficient. - Safe in the room. A small fridge. A table and 2 chairs. There is also WI-FI. Cons: I am nitpicking here. These are all relatively minor issues. - Rome was 'hot' in July, so walking was awful. Because of that, the place did not seem as convenient to go to sites. Had to take the tram (very little wait) and then either take a bus (which takes forever to arrive, as much as 20 minutes) or a taxi (which cost 10 euro of so). We returned to our hotel after lunch everyday, so it was a hassle for us. If you are the type that stays out all day, then this is a non issue for you. - You have to lock your room with a key even when you're in the room. We felt safe, but as a mom, felt uncomfortable because was wondering what will happen in the event of fire. You can't exactly just go out, you would need to grab the key and manage to unlock it while you're panicking. - Bells are ringing from a church nearby early on weekdays. I think it rang for about 200 times. It wakes me up and then I just fall asleep again. It did not wake up the rest of the family. - Curtains are sheer. It can be a bit warm in the morning and the sun may wake you up. And at night, neighbors will probably see you. We had blankets from the airplane and paper black clamps. So we put those over the sheer curtains and that solved the problem.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient and cool ... and different!”
Reviews.Author: accrington_martin
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the family room (the Marilyn Monroe room) for 3 nights earlier this month, plus another night at the end of our holiday (in between we travelled to Sorrento). Rome was baking hot, and it was nice to come back, cool down and freshen up at WRH. A strange place from the outside, you'd hardly guess it was a hotel. Inside it is quiet, cool, clean and decorated in a modern, minimalist style. Amongst the many things we appreciated were the shared common area with tea and coffee facilities, the free WIFI and laptop (great with teenagers!), the comfortable beds, the room safe (hardly necessary, with 3 doors/locks to get through from street level, but appreciated), the quiet air con (sometimes you forgot it was on), the cleanliness, and the extremely helpful Karl. Karl's advice on restaurants, sight seeing and bus routes was perfect, and in many ways made our holiday (we'd never have stumbled across the Birreria Peroni without Karl's recommendation - great food, terrific value). I should also mention Luigi who was assisting Karl and had just started that week - very helpful. Breakfast is taken across the road, at the Bar Lelli. A short stroll, quick and convenient - feel like a local! The location is very good. Quiet, yet convenient for all the sites and some excellent local restaurants. Would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Great”
Reviews.Author: 7777markw
Reviews.Content: As all the other reviews have stated , clean ,comfortable accommodation in a convenient location with very hospitable hosts . Not the normal coorporate accomodation and all the better for that .I will go back !

Reviews.Title: “Amazing, authentic, Nice people”
Reviews.Author: Arubaislandboy
Reviews.Content: Are staying there right now with 6 people in three rooms, love the location... Walking distance to vibrant trastevere and centro historico and ancient rome. Rooms are clean, trendy and comfortable. Staff is very Nice and helpfull. Would choose this sure above expensive posh big hotels!

Reviews.Title: “great stay, lovely staff ,great neighbourhood”
Reviews.Author: ramsesniblick
Reviews.Content: we had researched the hotel and were aware of the location so finding it was easy. the staff were very very helpful. Two things i found you might want to be aware of is 1. Bring earplugs, not cos things are noisy outside, or that its a noisy hotel but rather the walls are thin and the slightest noise can be heard 2. The wifi is good when it works but the laptop in our room was older than the colosseum (nearly) so dont be depending on it , if u have 3G phone it work brill the neighbourhood is really roman so lots of places to eat with lots of locals and a buzzing nightlife. Supermarket round the corner and tram stop across the road . lastly the brekkie is roman so dont expect fry up just lovely pastry and coffee from v nice people in Bar lelli across road

Reviews.Title: “The best Service in town”
Reviews.Author: Ofer_BatHefer_Israel
Reviews.Content: WRH TRASTEVERE have the feeling of a small family boutique hotel, we felt everything is totally under control, the stuff assist as with all our required and whishes with a big smile and without any delay. A problem with our transportation to the air port was solved by the stuff in no time, they even insist to pay for the alternative transportation. Our first call before our next visit to Rome will be to WRH TRASTEVERE with no doubt. The hotel and the friendly professional stuff were defiantly major part of our vacation success. Thank you for every thing!!! Ela & Ofer

Reviews.Title: “Best Place to Stay in Rome”
Reviews.Author: jamiereich
Reviews.Content: This was the best place to stay... first Trastevere is the best area in Rome to stay. It has incredible resturants, great public transportation, and walking distance to almost everything! Maria, Carl, Alex were all amazing! Maria has amazing restaurant reccommendations and places to see... We have no complaints whatsoever and would only stay here if in Rome. WRH made our trip- Do not think twice about booking.

Reviews.Title: “nice enough hotel fairly close to sightseeing but not a nice area”
Reviews.Author: terance
Reviews.Content: i am writing this review on the basis that those who read it will be arriving in rome as a tourist to do sightseeing as i was. getting to the hotel is not simple the first taxi driver i spoke to at the rome rail station said it would be 40 or 50 euros , i rejected his offer because i knew it was only a few miles to the hotel.the second taxi driver didnt quote a fare so i took a ride on the basis that the price would be in accordance with the fares schedule that is dispayed in his cab .the fare was 16 euros.this taxi driver didnt know the location of this hotel and endevoured to ask other taxi drivers as he was driving ,if they could give directions but he had no success.i ended up having to give him my map to show him where we were going.as it was he dropped us off on trastevere ave and we had to search for the hotel entrance ourself , luckily i had checked google map closely and found it. not a good start but i was prepared for this because other reviewers have had similar problems finding this hotel.now i know that this is not the fault of the hotel but it is something that prospective customers need to be aware of and that is why ive mentioned it. the hotel entrance is difficult to find because the street that its in, crisogono st, is so small only fifty metres long .once you locate the street its hard to see the hotel entrance because the signage is poor, its a plaque of about six inches by ten inches on the wall.the door to the hotel is a door such as you would find leading into a block of flats it does not look like your normal hotel entrance.use the intercom to gain entrance first time. once into the hotel you quickly realize that this hotel is in fact part of a block of flats , it looks to me like it has been converted from a large flat into a small hotel. once in the hotel it is clean tidy cheerful.the reception area is the area shown on their website as a communal area.the staff sit here and do their administration work. the staff are only in the hotel 8am to 5pm , i didnt find it a problem, you get a key to the entrance of this building plus a key to the hotel door itself which is on the first floor and you get a key to your room.three keys. my room was room five it was nice it was clean the bathroom was nice as well.no complaints at all. my last night was in room four its smaller than room five but just as nice to look at but it has one fault-the central heating boiler is located in a cupboard above the door to the bathroom and its very noisy, i was in rome at the end of april so the heating only went on at night, i turned the radiator off in my room but could not turn the boiler off so i had my sleep interupted til about 5am.i have to say that if id discovered this sooner i would have told the staff but it being my last night they had gone home for the night by the time i discovered the problem. the staff are superb multilingual very pleasant easy going helpful people. the area around the hotel is a bit scrappy and untidy , its not well lit at night but i felt safe so did my wife .there are good restaurants all around but when in rome check your prices before you eat or drink because there are scams going on , one menu for locals and another for tourists.this may be for the benefit of the different eating habits of the tourist but i noticed a big difference in price so i dont accept that it benefits the tourist at all, tourists are here to do as the romans do and that means we should be able to eat the same food at the same price and drink their drinks at the same price.this trickery is not just in the central tourist areas it exists all around.very disappointing indeed.watch out for charges for water, if you ask for non carbonated water sometimes restaurants bring you a designer bottle that has been filled with tapwater the lid is off when served and there is no label on the bottle and they try to charge four euros for it but dont tell you , they just put it on your bill !again i know this is not a hotel issue but its an issue with sorounding restaurants. getting to the sights is easy by foot back and forward across the bridge. if i were going to rome again i would choose a hotel on the other side of the river and i would choose a hotel that had a proper reception area and public area and a bar or restaurant so i had somewhere i could sit and have a drink after a busy day walking around rome.

Reviews.Title: “OUtstanding emergency find”
Reviews.Author: LondonKaytee
Reviews.Content: We found ourselves stranded in Italy by the volcanic dust problems and had to travel to Rome to meet up with a party from my school who were also stranded. Our reservation shortly before hitting the motorway from S Italy was driven by the recommendations of previous visitors and they were spot-on. AS we were thre to support the school group, we weren't really doing sight-seeing but the hotel is in a great location to do Rome on foot. Also a few steps away from bus and tram routes. The hotel is spotless, small and quite. The welcome was superb and they could not do enough to help, including phoning our car hire firm to check out arrangements for returning our car to a changed destination etc and giving us an unsolicited discount when we had a stay a second night whilst rearranging return arrangements for us and the school party staying elsewhere. Welcome at the breakfast cafe was equally warm. We will definitely return to see Rome properly.

Reviews.Title: “Felt like home...what a fantastic hotel :)”
Reviews.Author: katweller
Reviews.Content: After reading the positive reviews on Tripadvisor i was more than confident to book up. Luckily the reviews all spot on and it was beyond my expectations. The Room: Very spacious, Large bed, TV, Computer and internet access, Free WIFI, welcome bottle of wine :) minibar. The Decor was gorgeous and the bathroom was very modern and funky. The rooms very extremely clean and housekeeping cleared up the rooms everyday. THe view just looked out onto a backstreet-nothing amazing but this didnt bother us, if anything it was quite nice to be backed on to a small street as Rome can be a very loud place so we slept well. Location: I cannot fault the location. The hotel sits on the other side of the river from Rome. It takes 15 minutes to walk to the Pantheon and the Coliseum Alternatively you can take a tram half way then walk the rest. Being in Trastevere you are more in the heart of where the locals live. Cheaper food and tastier than the main tourist restaurants within Piazza Navona etc...which are expensive and the quality of food isn't as great. There are plenty of bars and restaurants to choose from just 5 minutes from the hotel. It is lovely walking around this area in the evening, a buzzy chilled out atmosphere. Breakfast: Breakfast is included and was served not in the hotel but across the road in a small quaint cafe. You are given a breakfast voucher to exchange and will get a pastry of your choice, coffee and a beautiful glass of fresh orange juice. The Staff: Were amazing, warm and welcoming offering great tips on restaurants, attractions and transport. Thankyou for making us feel at home and treating us so well. Tips: Our favourite restaurant was called 'LIFE' you can type it into Tripadvisor and lots of good reviews will pop up. Food was lovely and the desserts were amazing. It was quite well priced considering it was just off a couple of roads from the spanish steps. Go on the ROME FREE TOUR they offer 3 free tours and you just tip the guide at the end of the tour. The tour meets at SPANGA outside mcdonalds. If you type it into tripadvisor it should pop up. The guide was excellent and gives you a great insight into Rome. Take the train to Pompeii, we only paid £55 for two return train tickets. It takes two hours to arrive in Naples then its a 25 minute metro journey to the site. You can take teh shuttle bus but this takes a good three hours and costs £50 per person (min) not including entry fee. The train is a great way to see amazing views of Naples, Mount V and the coast.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent! Our warmest recommendations”
Reviews.Author: DrDane
Reviews.Content: We were trapped in Rome because of the Icelandic vulcano, and needed a new place to stay, because the hotel, we had stayed at during our stay, was fully booked. We stumbled across WRH Trastevere here on TripAdvisor, and now I only regret, we didn't stay here the whole week. From the outside, it looks kinda trashy, but once inside everything is really great: Clean and very modern. The place is packed with lots of cool details: a laptop i everything room, fast and free WiFi, very reasonable prices in the minibar (Pepsi: €2, Juice: €1, Chips: €1, Peanuts: €0,5), international channels on the TV, free espresso coffee 24h in the reception.... The staff is extremely friendly. Fabrizio booked a table for us at the very popular neighbourhood restaurant Enzo without us asking him to. I guess he thought it would be a good place for us (which it was!)

Reviews.Title: “Really lovely and excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Unrulymob
Reviews.Content: Fantastic rooms and bathrooms (spotlessly clean), and the kids loved the laptops. Very convenient - you can walk anywhere from here, and the local restaurants are excellent. Breakfast in the bar across the road is not huge, but the fresh orange juice and hot chocolate were amazing. The mini shared kitchen for coffee and cakes was great.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Goldens18
Reviews.Content: We just got back from our Rome visit. While in Rome, we stayed at WRH Trastevere. I can't say enough good things about this hotel. It's clean, in a great location and the employees there were wonderful. Maria and Alex were extremely helpful. They gave us wonderful restaurant recommendations. Thanks, Maria and Alex! We stayed in room 2 (the white room) and it was wonderful. It had nice light and airy. It's a little noisy if you have the windows open, but we didn't mind. The room also had a laptop and free wifi - a HUGE plus! We will definitely be staying here again the next time we're in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “easter trip to rome”
Reviews.Author: billbspenny
Reviews.Content: Could not be more pleased with hotel and staff. Maria was very freindly and helpful,gave us advice on where to eat and how to get to places of interest.Room was excellent and the bottle of wine in the room was well appreciated a gift for my birthday.We would recommend this hotel to any of our friends as we could not fault it.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly Surprised”
Reviews.Author: tolvida
Reviews.Content: Don't be fooled by the entrance, once inside it's warm clean and the staff are very friendly and helpful. Situated centrally in Rome very close to all the major visit sights, and some good resturants. A small kitchen area in the reception with free tea, coffee and snacks as required. Breakfast is served at Bar Nelly across the road from the hotel (vouchers were give for this) The staff were very helpful, in suggesting good resturants, transport and places to visit. The rooms were basic but warm, clean and comfortable and the bathrooms were well equipped and a good shower (always important). We intend to come back to Rome, and this is where we will be staying, Enjoy !!!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent - ideal for a weekend break in Rome”
Reviews.Author: MJF123
Reviews.Content: I spent some time trawling through reviews on here, finally booked the Trastevere based on the strong recommendations and we made the right choice. Excellent location for all the attractions the Pantheon and Coliseum etc were all in easy walking distance, we even walked to Vatican City, but the Trastevere is also well serviced by public transport links internal to Rome and the airport. Plus loads of great places for eating out are within 5mins walk. To be honest we were not to concerned about the hotel's amenities, as location was our priority, but the hotel was great. Nice modern stylish room, clean, comfy bed, shower was awesome and also we had free wifi. However, key for me was how helpful all the staff were - they made made our break. Look no further, book it.

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel i've ever stayed in!”
Reviews.Author: tequilauk
Reviews.Content: Do not miss out on this hotel! The Staff were the best ever, so helpful and knowledgeable, and the advice they gave us really made the holiday. They are only at the reception during rough office hours but will stay on when they know someone is checking in outside of those times and are totally happy and welcoming when we got there. They genuinely want every guest to get the most from Rome and are very good at it. You'll get keys to the building so you can come and go as you please whether they are there or not. The area is a shambolic and beautiful mix of bars cafes and restaurants with miles of alleyways to stroll through and enjoy, but the rustic and historical outside of the hotel is in total contrast to the inside where it is as clean as a whistle and as modern as you could want. Free internet access in all rooms on laptops, a safe in every room, excellent water pressure in the shower, free tea, coffee and basic kitchen facilities in the reception area, cleaner did a brilliant job every day, double glazed windows, most comfortable bed ever, you can't want for more from the money of the stay! The only down sides were thin wall on one side in room 5 so toilet flush from next door is fairly loud, and that the staff are not on hand 24 hours but i've travelled all over the world on varied budgets and this is the best hotel i've every stayed in.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent.”
Reviews.Author: rsfLondon
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel. Don’t let the outside of this concern you; the inside is bright, warm, and welcoming. My room (#5) and bathroom were large, clean, and very well furnished. There is free wireless and a laptop in the room. The WRH Trastevere has some of the best service I have ever experienced anywhere – better than most hotels at twice the cost. Thhis really sets it apart. The alley it’s on may not be attractive but it’s easy walking distance to many of Rome’s attractions. I stayed over Christmas and the staff left Prosecco and chocolate panettone for the guests. The only potential downsides – and they weren’t downsides for me – is that the hotel is not staffed at night and the hotel is quite small so I can imagine noise can travel. Again, neither was a problem for me. Try the pizza at Ai Marmi at Viale Trastevere 53-59, just 2 minutes walk away. Fantastic. And don’t let the queue out front deter you; it moves quickly.

Reviews.Title: “Will definitely stay at WH Trastevere again!”
Reviews.Author: Pondulay
Reviews.Content: My family enjoyed our five night stay at WRH. We had a lovely guest room with a one double bed and one single (for our twenty-two year old daughter); the overall decor of the establishment is hip and modern which we prefer. The WRH is very clean and each room has a laptop which was a great convenience. The staff is friendly and very helpful; Carl gave us a lot of good restaurant suggestions and we enjoyed our conversations with him. WRH is in a great location because Trastevere is close to the heart of Rome without being in the ultra touristy areas (where we usually avoid booking accommodations). As New Yorkers we like to walk, but there is a light rail system and buses on the main boulevard. We really liked Trastevere because it had a lot less tourists and more locals, and a cool nightlife. The folks at Bar Lelli greeted us warmly every morning; it was a good way to start the day.

Reviews.Title: “I can't say enough great things about WRH Trastevere!”
Reviews.Author: From_Delaware
Reviews.Content: Everything you've read is true. WRH Trastevere is a wonderful place to spend your holiday or business trip in Rome. First, the basics: it's a cozy five-room guesthouse one flight of stairs up from street level in a small residential building. All locks appear sturdy and secure. Rooms are smartly furnished, clean and comfortable (although some are quite small and a bit lacking in closet and drawer space), and all have private bathrooms. Neighborhood is quiet, at least by big-city standards. WiFi signal is strong, and each guest room is furnished with its own computer. TV too, although we never turned it on. The common area is cute and functional with coffee, tea and snacks always available, as well as a small library containing tourbooks and other reading material. (One possible downside is that we only got one set of keys to the building and the room, which could be complicated if my companion and I wanted to go off on separate adventures for part of our trip. But I suspect if we had asked we would have been given a second set of keys.) Maria and her crew, all fluent in English, go way above and beyond to make sure you can find the place, to welcome you warmly and sincerely when you get there, and to ensure you get the most from your visit to Rome. Maria clearly loves Rome and loves Trastevere, and she wants you to love them too. The hotel isn't staffed full time; nevertheless you always feel well taken-care-of (but never smothered). And the rates are very reasonable. As others have noted, a bottle of wine and some snacks awaited us in our room when we checked in. Prior to that, Maria had emailed detailed instructions for getting to the hotel by taxi or bus from the train station, and gave us a cellphone number to call if we ran late or needed help. Although we arrived after hours, Carl tracked our train status online and was there at the door to greet us when we arrived in Trastevere. About a week before our arrival we got another email from Maria with suggested day-by-day itineraries for exploring Rome, which were quite helpful. When she gave us her dining recommendations they definitely weren't the sort of commercial arrangements that some hotels have with the local restaurants, but rather the places where she herself likes to go out to eat -- yet tailored to our taste and desires. When we asked where in the neighborhood to buy bus/tram tickets, Maria gave us two and wouldn't let us pay her for them. (Compare that to other hotels that would charge you a service charge for buying a bus ticket from them.) Then she answered our question, once we had the two free tickets in our hands. Breakfast is served at a neighborhood cafe a short walk away, paid for with a voucher from the hotel that you're given at check-in: one voucher per guest per day. It's the typical Roman breakfast of a sweet roll, juice and coffee. Nothing special, but you really feel like a local there tossing down your espresso with the townies on their way to work. Newsstand next to the cafe has foreign newspapers: the Int'l Herald Tribune and the Financial Times are same-day while the other British papers are one day late, as is typical throughout Rome. My companion and I joked that Trastevere is Italian for "Brooklyn" because that's what the neighborhood feels like: very close to the city center but wonderfully apart from it; a real neighborhood, built to savor with long stolls and al fresco dining, peopled by earthy old-timer natives, hipsters, professionals, expats and more. The small number of tourists mainly show up at night for the restaurant scene, or stop by briefly during the day to see the artwork in some of the neighborhood churches (a Bernini sculpture two blocks away; 12th-century mosaics depicting the life of Mary a bit farther). Many locals will tell you Trastevere is "over" but although I've never been there before I didn't feel that gentrification has necessarily spoiled its fundamental character and charm. There's something in Trastevere for everyone. Despite being across the river from the city center, Trastevere is amazingly close to many of Rome's essential sights: Campo di Fiori and Piazza Navona, the ancient Roman ruins, Capitoline Hill, the Pantheon and the Vatican are actually closer on foot or by transit to Trastevere than they are to the more traditional hotel districts around Piazza Spagna or Via Veneto. The neighborhood is heavily and freqently served by public transit (including to the airport), the Tiber is bridged every couple hundred meters, and there's a taxi stand just a block from the hotel. What a great way to see Rome. Thanks to WRH Trastevere for a memorable visit.

Reviews.Title: “We LOVED Trastevere and we loved WRH!!”
Reviews.Author: IQTraveler
Reviews.Content: Rome was our last stop on a 9-day whirlwind trip to Italy and it was so the icing on the cake. We absolutely loved the city and that had a lot to do with Trastevere and our stay at WRH. Maria, one of the owners (?) of WRH, emailed me a couple of weeks before our trip to find out when we were getting in and to offer some tips for where to go and what to see. Such attentive hosts at WRH! She also gave us great directions for getting to the hotel but, unfortunately, I lost them. Thankfully, our taxi driver was able to figure out where to go...it took him a bit but he figured it out eventually. Yes, the hotel is in a very nondescript building on an alley/small street but once you get up to the hotel, you will be pleasantly surprised. And once you get to your room, you will be thrilled. And once you start walking around the neighborhood, you will be ecstatic! Our first night there, we walked through Trastevere, stopped and got a "birre to takeaway" and walked to Piazza Navona for a cocktail outside. We had the BEST time walking and then people watching. And Maria had a great recommendation for dinner that night in Trastevere. The restaurant was called La Scala and we sat outside and enjoyed the nightlife of the neighborhood. We packed all the sites into one day the next day and had another fabulous dinner in Trastevere the next night. (We could have spent the entire time in that neighborhood and been happy as clams.) Our room was a haven to come "home" to both days/nights. When we first arrived, they had a bottle of wine waiting for us with a "Happy Anniversary" card for our 1-year anniversary. Such a nice touch. It meant a lot to us. And the canopy bed was beautiful and so comfortable. It was a very roomy room and we felt completely at home there. And the service was incredible! Maria was there the first day and got out a map and pointed out a bunch of different restaurants/ bars to go to and sites to see. I can't remember the gentleman's name that was there the next day but he was equally great. We actually saw him out at a bar later that night and chatted with him for a bit. Really good people. And they both spoke English perfectly, which was great for us since we didn't learn a lick of Italian before we went. (Everyone knows English but it would have been nice to have known a little Italian just so we could embed ourselves in the culture a little more.) I would highly recommend WRH to anyone visiting Rome. It's in a great location (the walk to all the sites was beautiful and not far) and the service was wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “Can't recommend highly enough”
Reviews.Author: Merlin's_view
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a five day holiday in Rome. Chose to stay in Trastevere as we'd visited previously and really liked the area - very laid back, lots of good places to eat and very convenient for the city centre. We stayed at WRH Trastevere on the basis of TripAdvisor reviews - unusually for hotel reviews, nobody had a single bad thing to say. After our visit I can understand why. The rooms were light and airy, comfortably furnished and very reasonably priced for Rome. We were greeted with a welcome present bottle of wine and snacks and our room was equipped with a laptop with internet access. The location is very convenient being close to the river and central Rome with trams and buses stopping within a hundred yards or so of the apartment. The major plus though were the staff who were all incredibly friendly and helpful with every aspect of our stay. If you want to stay somewhere with a relaxed atmosphere at a very reasonable price, I would thoroughly recommend WRH Trastevere.

Reviews.Title: “A hiddem gem in a wonderful neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: Dr_Van_Nostran
Reviews.Content: I spent three nights in this hotel and I couldn't have had a better experience. The rooms are fantastic - very hip and modern, but most importantly clean and comfortable. The staff were wonderful - they really made us feel at home and were so helpful in suggesting restaurants and other places to check-out. The location is perfect - Trastevere is a great neighborhood to stay and you're just a short walk to the river and the city center. I highly recommend this hotel and look forward to staying there on my next trip to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Like staying in a friend's very cool apartment”
Reviews.Author: drum19464
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at the WRH Trastevere for three nights in the beginning of November. The hotel doesn't have a desk staff 24 hours a day, so if you're planning on coming in before 8:30am or after 5:30pm you have to make arrangements in advance. We'd told the staff we'd be in by 3pm, but due to car trouble we weren't able to make it into Rome until close to 9pm. I called the hotel and told them about the situation, and they couldn't have been more accommodating-- the owner (I think?) gave us his cell number and told us we just had to give him 15 minutes warning and not to worry. Once we got inside the hotel, I was absolutely charmed. There was a bottle of Sangiovese on the bed for us and a bowl of little snacks and candies...the way to my heart. The decor is cool, very modern, and our room was comfortable and lovely (even though the shower was tiny, it was clean, done in a cool red tile and had great water pressure). I would absolutely recommend the WRH Trastevere-- it's a superb value and a lovely place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “A hidden gem”
Reviews.Author: debbieSouthampton
Reviews.Content: as a first time traveller to rome i needed help to find somewhere suitable that would suit our pocket and give us a great location in rome. WRH Trastevere came up tops the staff were so helpful with advise before we arrived and once we were there, they booked trips for us,suggested restaurants to try and orgnised our pick and drop off back to the airport. the room was large enough for my husband and our adult daughter, the bathroom was huge with plenty of hot water. although we never used the public transport it was all very near by. as all the previous reviews have commented on do not be put off by the outside because the hotel is great

Reviews.Title: “Good location, great staff”
Reviews.Author: dkny714
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed staying at this hotel in Trastevere. It is nice to get out of the city center and stay in a part of Rome that feels more authentic. It is only a 5 minute walk to the Tiber and the #8 tram goes by constantly which takes you to Largo Argentina. The room was stayed in was nice. Very modern. Good size bathroom for Europe. The room had a laptop but the wireless was out when we were there. The breakfast was served at a cafe down the main road- pastry, cappuccino, fresh squeezed orange juice. The staff at the hotel was unbelievably nice. They tried to help us out in any way they could. When we were having trouble finding a place to buy a bus pass, the employee (I forgot his name) gave us 2 passes. He also let us print our boarding passes out from the hotel's computer. Very nice. I would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful hotel for families on a budget”
Reviews.Author: travelinjane_9
Reviews.Content: I reserved this hotel because of the good ratings on Trip Advisor and its reasonable price for Rome. I agree fully with the previous reviews. I traveled with my husband and daughter and her family which included two children, ages 7 and 10. The rooms were great. The common room was a good place to interact with family members and other guests. The staff was most helpful. Tourist attractions were within walking distance or easily reachable by public transportation. A computer was provided for free use in every room. Guests must be able to climb a flight of stairs to the second floor.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value, Great People- Very Nice for budget travel !”
Reviews.Author: kbatlanta
Reviews.Content: Drive up to this hotel next to this unmarked building and you might worry you made a mistake. The hotel is basically a floor in a an apartment buidling, so it's looks are deceiving. Inside, very clean, very nice small room with A/C, great tiny bathrooms with modern, clean showers. Not a full service hotel, but what a great value in the nice trastevere neighborhood- close to lots of restaurants and not far from all the sights. The only complaint we had is the internet did not work. The owner/manager was VERY helpful and friendly. Great clean modern choice for a budget traveler.

Reviews.Title: “Hip gem in Trastevere”
Reviews.Author: annw
Reviews.Content: This small (5 room) b&b is tucked into a side street near the main artery into Trastevere, on the second floor of a rather humdrum building which gives no hint of the bright, clean rooms inside. Location ends up being an excellent spot from which to explore the neighborhood and the many good restaurants in the area. While the front desk is not staffed 24/7 but rather business hours, and you will need to coordinate arrivals outside of those hours, once checked in you get keys to come and go as you please, and you nonetheless have support for directions, ordering a car for the airport, and the like. (I found this spot very convenient for my "night before" flying back to the US.) The rooms themselves are stylish, with cool furniture, mosaic tile, rainwater showerheads, and the like, including laptops with Internet access. There's a kitcheonette/dining area with complimentary snacks such as coffees, teas, pastries and fresh fruit. For breakfast, though, you get cards/coupons for complementary breakfast at a cafe across the main road, consisting of fresh squeezed orange juice, an espresso drink, and a brioche or pastry. I would definitely book here again, unless I needed the services of a large hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing find and great value - Best of the the hotels we stayed at in Italy.”
Reviews.Author: ColdInMinneapolis
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just returned from a 4 night stay at the hotel and loved it. Here are some insights into our experience: Location: The location is within walking distance to all of the major tourist attractions (about 20 minutes to the Pantheon or 5-10 if you take public transportation). The location of the hotel is in a great non-touristy part of Rome so we felt like we had a more authentic experience than we would have if we stayed in other neighborhoods in Rome. There are many great restaurants close to the hotel and public transportation is just steps away. As stated in other reviews, the entrance to the hotel is non-descript and doesn't reflect the quality of the hotel. Hotel Accommodations: The hotel is very clean, modern, and large for European standards. As soon as we walked through the doors we were glad that we had booked a room here. An unusual, but very welcome surprise was the fact that the rooms all have central air conditioning, a must have on a 90 degree plus day. The laptop computer located in the room and wireless internet provided free of charge was a nice bonus. Staff: We were immediately provided with great insights for restaurants and directions on how to get to them. Prior to our trip we purchased a Rick Steve's book on Italy, but after receiving local recommendations we never referred to the book for destinations to eat and were never disappointed. Before we arrived, we were sent a helpful email asking us if they could assist us during our stay by booking museum passes, which we took them up on. This hotel is probably not best suited for larger families; however I would suggest to anyone I know visiting Rome that they stay at the WRH Trastervere.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in Rome”
Reviews.Author: California86
Reviews.Content: After reading the glowing reports about WRH Tavestere on Trip Advisor, we reserved a room for our June 2009 week in Rome. Along with general satisfaction with the room, location, and facilities, we were looking for indications in the reviews that the staff was helpful, as this was our first stay in Rome in many years. The glowing reports turned out to be quite accurate. The room was clean and comfortable and the location was perfect. We easily found excellent restaurants and an official tourist information booth (for our Roma Passes) within easy walking distance, and a quick ride on #8 takes you to the hub of Rome’s historical attractions. Breakfast at a friendly coffee shop across the street is included in the price. When we arrived, there was a bottle of wine waiting, plus daily fresh flowers and a central kitchen-lobby area that was always stocked with fresh fruit, a coffee machine, and various pastries and snacks. The best attributes of the place are Carl and Maria, who provided great advice and made reservations for us, not only for activities related to our stay in Rome, but also for activities planned for the second leg of our trip in Florence. Maria even emailed us with suggestions and tips two weeks before our departure from the USA, inviting us to reply with any questions. We did, and ended up with some excellent advice and arrangements from both Carl and Maria that made our trip all the better. This place is special. We recommend it with no hesitation and would certainly stay there again.
