Reviews.Title: “Terrific Hotel in an Amazing Location!”
Reviews.Author: Brandie_in_Boston
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for three nights (July 5-8, 2009). We had an incredible stay. Trastevere is a wonderful place to have as a base in Rome. We absolutely loved it. It has a real old-world charm to it with tons of restaurants and is accessible by foot to all the major tourist sites. Additionally, from Termini, you can hop on a bus H and it takes you straight to the hotel. The hotel itself was extremely clean, comfortable and well-designed. The laptop in the room was also a huge help. The staff was gracious and accommodating. Although breakfast is served off-site (literally a 2 minute walk across the street), there are basic kitchen facilities in the main area of the hotel - stocked with coffee and snacks which you can help yourself. We HIGHLY recommend this hotel to anyone considering a stay in Rome. You won't regret it.

Reviews.Title: “Home away from home”
Reviews.Author: zvk20022002
Reviews.Content: My husband & I stayed 4 nights at WRH Trastevere in June 09 & absolutely loved it! The outside of the hotel looks like a post-war building, but once you are inside....... it is just amazing! Every room is different (there are only 5 rooms) and very tastefully decorated. We stayed at the red room & it was great: clean, spacious, great bed, fantastic shower, airco and even a laptop in every room. We had a bottle of wine waiting for us upon our arrival, such a nice touch! Then hosts are very welcoming & knowledgeable, so you will feel at home in no time. In the common room you can get tea/coffee all day long (self-service) as well as fruit and sweet snacks. Breakfast is served in a cafe nearby & the coffee was the best we had in Rome. I can go on for a long time describing how fantastic this place is, but if you have to experience it yourself! This little gem will make your trip to Rome unforgettable.

Reviews.Title: “You owe it to yourself to visit Rome and stay here”
Reviews.Author: qmonahan
Reviews.Content: I won't bother to repeat everything that has already been said, but I must stress - this is a GREAT place to stay. My wife and I loved every minute at WRH Trastevere. Maria and Carl couldn't have been more accommodating and helpful. Once you find the hotel and get your bearings on the neighborhood everything is fantastic. You feel like you're having an authentic Italian/Rome experience - not a tourist adventure. Plan to walk a lot to major attractions, but not so much you'll ruin your experience. Transportation is easily available if you choose to use it - it just takes time to learn how to access it. One other piece of advice - AVOID the Archeobus. You'll be wasting money and time. Find alternate transportation if you want to visit the Catacombs. I would HIGHLY recommend staying at WRH Trastevere. We miss it already!

Reviews.Title: “Don't judge a book by it's cover!”
Reviews.Author: donica
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel because of the great reviews on TA and because it was in the convenient Trastevere area. From the outside, when our cab let us off, we were a little concerned by the door in the alley and the tiny sign. However, once we went up the stairs to the second floor reception area, we were completely pleased with the decor and the friendliness of the staff. Our room was very comfortable with a queen size bed in the center and a twin on either side, with an aisle in between. We also had a decent size bathroom and a computer area with laptop included. There was also a small closet with a safe and refridge. Very clean and comfortable. Light breakfast incl. across the street at a small cafe. Located off main street and easy to catch busses, however, we walked to all attractions except the Vatican.

Reviews.Title: “Don't Stay Anywhere Else”
Reviews.Author: fulljaffa
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel because of its' location in Trastevere. The area is full of locals at night, eating out in restaurants that produce good food at reasonable prices. We happily wandered through the charming streets soaking up the atmosphere. There are some great bars and the nightlife in Trastevere was one of the highlights of the whole trip. The staff at the hotel were great. They arranged transport from and to the airport which saved us hours of travelling and gave us extra time to enjoy Rome. Very knowledgeable and helpful if you needed them. The room was quirky and a real joy to return back to after a long days walking. The laptop in the room was great for keeping in touch with the world. From the hotel we walked to all of the major sites that you would want to visit. We did not have to use one bus / tram / train / taxi during the whole of our four night stay. I could go on, but I would only be repeating the positive things that others have already written. Highly recommended..............missing it already..............

Reviews.Title: “Lovely place!”
Reviews.Author: jenkins11
Reviews.Content: We had a great time at the Wrh Travestre. Our room was very well decorated and the staff were really helpful. We went for my girlfriend's birthday, on the day of her birthday we arrived back at our room to be welcomed by a bottle of wine, two glasses and some nibbles, very nice touch! The location is very good for exploring Rome with all of the attractions within walking distance. If we return to Rome this would certainly be where we would stay, superb!

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: travelerje
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had a great time in Rome, partly owed to our wonderful stay at WRH Trastevere. I agree with the other travelers that when you first arrive, you will be taken aback by the back road entrance and lack of signs. However, once we went inside, we were impressed with the interior - Very clean and modern. The staff was extremely courteous, helpful and genuinely interested in helping us adjust and plan out our days. They are only there during the day (i think 8-6pm) but an emergency contact number was provided and these hours were never a problem for us during our 3 night stay. Our room was surprising large (I've heard numerous stories of hotels rooms in Rome the size of closets), bathroom was clean and spacious, and room service cleaned every day and provided fresh towels. We did not have any problems with noise from adjacent rooms. I loved the neighborhood. Trastevere feels less touristy than the majority of Rome and is fun to wander at night since there are a lot of restaurants and cafes open nearby. It's still close enough to all the major sites that you can walk or take the bus. We walked everywhere but be warned you should bring comfortable walking shoes. Breakfast is free at the cafe one block away and consists of coffee, freshly squeezed OJ and croissant. There is also a coffee machine in the hotel lobby and cookies that you can help yourself to anytime during the day. There is also free wi-fi in the rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Ave WRH TRASTEVERE !!!!”
Reviews.Author: DianitaBat
Reviews.Content: What a pleasure ! We spent only 2 nights there but we wish that we could stay more...Cosy, trendy decoration, very friendly staff, very good situation, and perfect for a couple. You feel just like home ! Go there, you won't regret it !

Reviews.Title: “Could not have wished for better”
Reviews.Author: foohan2001
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for three nights. Its a small hotel with 5 rooms. I was a little concerned when I walked through the alley to get to the hotel but as soon as i walked throuh the hotel door, I knew this was a winner. The hotel room was large, modern and clean with a fantastic shower, air conditioning, lcd tv, laptop with wireless connection and a bottle of wine to welcome us. the communal kitchen is just outside in the reception area with the fantastic coffee machine that I used far too often. The service is personal and very friendly. And to top it off, the hotel is excellent value for money. I normally stay in large hotels so the level of service was beyond belief. I recommend the hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “A Delight to Stay Here”
Reviews.Author: GlasgowCitybreaker
Reviews.Content: This is a really fantastic hotel. The room was lovely, and with everything you could want. Really appreciated the computer in the room with free wi-fi., coffee making facilities and free cakes etc The location is great. Within walking distance of all the sights but off the beaten track. Trastervere has loads of great restaurants and bars- so its a great base, but the street the hotel is on really quiet. The staff are really friendly. They are also great at giving you advice on the best local - non touristy- restaurants. If Allesandro recommends a restaurant- then go! All in all I couldn't recommend it more- and the price is a real bargain too.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful location and service-perfect stay.”
Reviews.Author: withwill
Reviews.Content: Ahh we loved this place. It is a small hotel in a block of flats with just five rooms. We were in room 5 which was lovely. Great four poster bed, free wifi, phone, lovely bathroom with great shower and all very clean. The best thing is the location and the friendliness and attentiveness of the owners. I totally agree with all the other great things said about this place. The area is superb, you can walk everywhere, we never got any public transport. Trastevere is wonderful full of great bars, restaurants and shops and amazing churches and out of the main tourist area. (go to St Cecila nearby and ask to look at the fresco on the first floor-just amazing). Rooms were cleaned every day and we gor fresh towels on the second day. There is free soap and shower gel and a hair dryer. Breakfast is easy and actually nice to eat in a local cafe just 1 min away, lovely pastries and my coffee was great. I loved the freshly squeezed orange juice and the service is friendly. The comunal area is great for free coffee, there is a kettle, free cakes and biscuits, tables and information. The sound proofing is generally fine, once we could hear people in the next room and somtimes the shower but people were courteous and this in NO WAY detracted from our stay-we were very happy. We found that we a member of staff was there when we needed them and gave great advice. Crucially they seemed genuinely interested and invested in our stay and making sure we had a great time. This is a great choice if you have been looking endlessly at hotels in Rome-trust these reviews.

Reviews.Title: “great stay”
Reviews.Author: bcbene
Reviews.Content: WRH Trastevere was an excellent value -- inexpensive, clean and very comfortable. The room was quiet, with double glass windows overlooking a side street. The canopied double bed was fine, and there was a PC, TV and telephone. The bathroom could have used a larger table to spread our toiletries. The tram stop was around the corner, taking us across the river to Largo Argentina. Walking to the centro is not far either. Alessandro and Maria couldn't have been more helpful about everything. Maria referred us to nearby Ombre Rosse bar/restaurant, where we spent many pleasant hours drinking the wine, listening to the excellent music, chatting with the locals and eating the (free) buffet.

Reviews.Title: “What a GEM!!!!”
Reviews.Author: malteser1380
Reviews.Content: What a gem!! Ingrid | December 2008 On my third visit to the stunning eternal city of Rome & my mother’s first, I spent many hours in search of the hotel which felt right for us. I am quite picky however was not after a 5 star property this time. Although we wanted to be central, we weren’t after being in the heart of the touristic areas of the city, which sometimes tend to diminish its charm. I found a gem named wrh-trastevere, which is a converted apartment in an old block located in Trastevere, which is a stone throw away from the river and a 15 minute stroll from the city centre [the first landmark being the gorgeous Campo de Fiori]. The place has been renovated up to very high specifications, giving it a warm, contemporary feel. We absolutely loved it and what we loved even more is the hospitality received by the owners – Alessandro, Maria and Francesco!! W E L L D O N E guys and T H A N K Y O U!! We arrived at the hotel at about 1030hrs am and found Alessandro to greet us. He offered us an espresso, talked us through the map of the city, suggested a couple of typical restaurants in the area – made us feel very comfortable and welcome! Although we had been informed we would not be able to check in before 1400hrs, our room was ready by 1130hrs. This doesn’t happen often in hotels especially when they’re running at full occupancy so this was an added bonus!! The room was exactly as the photos & description on the website so no surprises there. The idea of placing wifi enabled laptops in the rooms is brilliant!! The bathroom was lovely with hot running water at all times, excellent power shower & toiletries topped up daily. Always impeccably clean as was the bedroom. I must say my biggest fear must have been the beds however both the mattress and pillows were very comfortable and the duvets very warm and cosy. The constant air conditioning contributed towards our comfort and warmth in the room and lounge area. Oh and there is also a bowl of sweets which is refilled every day ;) !! They really have thought of every little detail!! Even though the reception is not manned 24 hours a day, Alessandro, Maria and Fabrizio leave a note in the room and in the reception detailing their contact numbers in case of emergencies. As they live close by, there is no reason to be preoccupied. The area and apartment block are very safe and we never felt threatened! In the reception area there are a few tables and chairs and a kitchenette with an espresso machine, kettle, hob, fridge – all at one’s disposal. It’s a lovely little lounge area where one can help himself to the delicious Italian coffee [on tap - another plus point] or make himself a cup of tea whilst reading one of the many magazines, books or guides on Rome made available by the owners. There are also facilities to cook yourself a meal, but with all the local restaurants of Trastevere serving typical Roman specialities, it would be rude to do so! Even though the facilities are available, breakfast is not served at wrh itself, however you are given vouchers to be exchanged at a typical Italian Bar called Bar Lelli, which is just across the road from the hotel on the beautiful tree lined Viale Trastevere. An excellent start to your day with traditional Italian cappuccino or espresso, juice and a fresh [cornetto] croissant. My personal favourite was the chocolate one – mmm divine!! The service at Bar Lelli was excellent too and the gentlemen who worked there would recognise us every morning and also remembered that I drank my cappuccino without cocoa on top from the start! I must say I was quite sad to leave wrh-trastevere however I certainly will be back and am also keeping my fingers crossed that the owners will expand nationally and internationally as I will definitely be one of their regulars!!

Reviews.Title: “Experience the real Rome”
Reviews.Author: l0tiongirl
Reviews.Content: Although we could have stayed at any hotel in Rome, we chose not to stay in the high tourist areas, which are known to have poorer choices of food (not to mention more expensive) preying on tourist who do not to know any better along with other things. If you want to experience the true city of Rome and meet friendly locals, WRH is an excellent option. It is still in the city center and close walking proximity to all sites. Further, it is just steps away from the tram, bus lines and a taxi stand. It starts with the great staff, which include Fabrizio and Alex, both of whom speak Italian and English. SInce they own the hotel, it's more than just a job to them. They really want all of their guests to have a pleasant stay and will do whatever they can to ensure this is accomplished. The rooms are simply furnished and have everything one could possible need. As a traveler, my only requirements are that the room be clean, bed comfortable and that the shower be hot. WRH met all requirements and in fact, exceeded in shower requirement due to the modern, "rain-style" showerhead that offered a perfect spa retreat after a long day. One reviewer commented that the shower head did not offer a good shower experience, and I simply must disagree. It was excellent. There were also plenty of wall hooks for towels, so not sure why this was also an earlier complaint. As for the transparent glass door dividing the bathroom from the rest of the room, this does exist. Ours had a funky string curtain closing off most of it to the room, but it still allowed for some visibility. If you're not comfortable with this, than maybe you shouldn't be sharing a room with this person anyway. We were not bothered. The free in-room laptop with wi-fi was great and useful even though we brought our own Mac which also picked up the signal just fine. The rooms were spotless everyday with the usual clean towels. Breakfast entails tickets to redeem at a coffee bar across the street, which is a pleasure in and of itself. I have used such coupons elsewhere on travels, and they can get mixed reviews since the proprieters may look down on them being redeemed at their establishments, but this was not the case with WRH and the corresponding coffee bar--Bar Lelli. Every morning, we got free coffee of choice (Cappucino, Espresso, etc.) and a baked good per person/per room. It is not typical to have a heartier breakfast than this in Rome, so if breakfast is your big meal of the day, you will have to find it elsewhere...maybe back at home. Trastevere is one of the few neighborhoods left that is not a tourist trap. Since locals live in this neighborhood and dine here, the food often is much better than in other areas. Some recommendations include Mani di Pasta, Roma Spasita, Enzo, and Frontino. I do agree that the hotel is a little hard to find, but only just a little. It's just off the Piazza Mastai, a known landmark. Once found, you will not be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “A treasure in Trastevere”
Reviews.Author: NYLON2008
Reviews.Content: If you know Rome, you know that nice hotels are expensive and almost non existent in Trastevere the ancient, romantic, and fascinating neighborhood 'across the Tibre'. This hotel is such a treasure I almost thought twice about posting this review for fear you would all flock there and spoil the secret. But, the proprieters are so lovely, so conscientious and have put together such a beautiful, perfect little hotel that I couldn't resist. The hotel is really more of a small guest house, at the top of a flight of stairs, in an old roman town house in Trastevere. There are just 5 rooms but there is a roomy, relaxing lobby area and while the experience is quiant, it is totally free of any of the usual, suposedly charming, European pensione idiosyracies. You keep and carry your room keys with you. The staff are friendly but not overbearing or overly chatty. the rooms are newly and immaculately finished in a sort of 'up scale Ikea' style - clean lines, modern designs, but full of beautiful details like a red mosaic tyles or crystal chandelliers. We stayed in room 5, which I saw pictures of on the hotel website and requested specially 9they were more thna happy to reserve the exact room I requested though this is a very big room and has an 'upgrade' price. Room 5 has a big iron canpoy bed, a small table, day bed / sofa, full closet and big bright roomy bathroom. It was actually more space than we really needed for a 'city break' weekend during which we only stopped back at the hotel to shower for dinner and sleep. I had a chance to look at some of the other rooms which were much smaller but certainly would have served our purposes for the weekend. The included breakfast meant free coissants and coffee at one of the bars / coffee shops across the street. The bar in question was unfortunately quite horrible but at 80 euro cents for a cappuccino anywhere else in Rome, this didn' bother us. The hotel is just off of Vialle di Trastevere, a major (but not noise) thoroughfare that crosses the river and leads right into the historicalcentre of Rome where all of the more famous sites are concentrated. You are about a 15 minute stroll to the Pantheon, Piazza Navona, 20 from the Trevi Fountin, Roman Forum and there is nothing you cannot see in walking distance. We even walked easily to the vatican. but the best part of the hotel and my reason for being so thrilled to fianally find such a nice place in Trastevere is that Trastevere itself is a winding cobbled allyway old neighborhood jammed pack with a variety of fun, romantic, young, hip, elegant (everything) bars and restaunrants and my first choice for a breakfast stroll, evening cocktails, great dinner and / or 'night out. Before you leave this hotel in Trastever MAKE SURE you go to the pizzaria on Vialle di Trastevere immidiately in front of the hotel - it has big while neon signage, you can't miss it and it is the best pizza I have had anywhere in the world (and that includes extensive travel in Italy and years of living in NY! This hotel is a dream and a saviour for tourists who want to experience the real Rome, travel in style and comfort and not spend too much. GO!

Reviews.Title: “Would highly recommend it”
Reviews.Author: aschaf
Reviews.Content: We stayed at WRH Trastevere in August 2008 in a double room and were very happy with our stay. The room was clean and attractive, with two large windows and air conditioning as well. We were also very pleased to have free use of a laptop with wifi in the room. The location was great, in walking distance of several major attractions, and there were many restaurants around. The owners were very accessible and friendly, and there were many personal touches, e.g. fresh flowers and a handwritten note in the room. Free breakfast at a cafe down the street was included (coffee and a croissant), though there were kitchen facilities in the common room. We would definitely stay here again if we return to Rome. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “simply great”
Reviews.Author: CGN-MXP
Reviews.Content: perfect location, nice rooms and more than helpfull and friendly staff

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: QCGlobetrotters
Reviews.Content: We had a great time at WRH Trastevere in September. This part of Trastevere is an ideal location if you want to be at a short walk (at most 15 minutes depending on the attraction) from all of the major attractions and yet live among Romans and be part of their everyday lives. Upon arrival, we were welcome by a very warm staff who, throughout our stay, was always there to help us and who made our stay much more enjoyable. I must admit that our cab driver had a difficult time finding the hotel and that the hotel could have been better advertised from the outside. However, as soon as we set foot inside, we felt comfortable. The rooms are very modern (Ikea style, which can be explained by the fact that one of the owners is Swedish) and are equipped with all desired amenities (including the all important laptop and free internet). Food is a very important part of our trips and the best restaurants we had during our stay were all located within minutes of the hotel (within Trestevere) and were recommended by the hotel staff. Therefore, do not hesitate to ask for, and follow, their recommendations. If we ever go back to Rome, we will definitely book with WRH. Frank & Sylvie

Reviews.Title: “Sweet sweet location, wonderful staff!”
Reviews.Author: Swimmydown
Reviews.Content: The location is wonderful; the little street it is on is pretty quiet but near lots of good food, walks, the river Tiber. The staff was very helpful, informative, and talented. The wireless hookup was easy and strong. The rooms are extremely stylish, very clean, well appointed, and comfortable. I must note that the bathroom in our room was a bit too-well integrated into the sleeping area!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous stay in Rome”
Reviews.Author: Xirto84
Reviews.Content: I spent 5 nights at the WRH Travestere in September while in congress in Rome with my wife. We were greeted by the friendliest staff we have ever encountered; they took a great care of their clients. Our room was modern, spacious, even by American standards which is quite rare in Europe, and kept spotless during our stay. I enjoyed the laptop in the room to keep up with emails and travel information (...and write this review!). We really liked staying in Travestere which is the most authentic neighborhood in Rome with restaurants serving something else than "il menu touristico". From the hotel, we were able to walk everywhere; Piazza Santa Maria in Travestere, Piazza Navona, Fontana dei Trevi, Campo de fiori, Piazza di Spagna, etc... If you prefer using public transportation, there is a tram line near the property. I would stay at this hotel again and recommend it for sure. The hosts are truly exceptional (Maria and the managers) and I couldn't have wished for more.

Reviews.Title: “Great, Friendly B&B”
Reviews.Author: dickdanpete
Reviews.Content: We found the WRH Trastevere by accident on the internet and I think that's pretty much the only place you would find it as it is very hidden away from the outside. On arriving in Rome we couldn't find the hotel so the owners actually came to find us which was great. The hotel is a large converted apartment in a really great area of Trastevere. You aren't right on the square so you can sleep at night but you are only a couple of minutes walk from the main bit of Trastevere and about 15 from the Colloseum area. There are loads of great restaurants filled with locals (always a good sign) and transport to the airport is really easy via tram and train. I would certainly recommend this place to anyone I know going to Rome, It's perfect. Each of the rooms is decorated differently and there are only 5 of them in total so if you are staying for a while you can get to know your fellow guests. The room rates we got were great and the staff were brilliant. Enjoy your stay...!

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: Ms_XHelsinki
Reviews.Content: Overall, we were very satisfied with our experience in WRH Trastevere: location is great, right in the middle of everything, but still a very quiet street and building. Rooms are nicely furnished and clean and fairly good sized, nice high room & windows. Helpful and friendly staff that speaks excellent English (Thanks Franco!). We were 2 women staying in the white room and it was lacking shelf space/hooks in the bathroom, that was the only inconvenience on our stay. We also used the car service the hotel arranged for our airport pick up, and it was great. Otherwise it would have been almost impossible to find the tiny street and the right building in the middle of the night.

Reviews.Title: “Small lovely place in the heart of rome”
Reviews.Author: lecce-afficionado
Reviews.Content: We spent 2 nights in Rome and choose this small but very comfortable appartment hotel in the middle of the trastevere district. We got a beautiful bedroom with very stylish furniture and w-lan computer access, safe, minibar.... all inclusive in the very reasonabile price. The trastevere is perfectly situated in the middle of rome and all the sight are in walking distance which made it very easy and uncomplicated to reach the most important galleries, forums, etc. Our judgment is 5 stars for what you get and we will be certainly coming back to wrh trastevere at our next visit of rome.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but overpriced”
Reviews.Author: wla34
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location and we agree with all comments about the friendliness of staff. However the rooms are small and noise travels between them. Also, breakfast is now at a cafe across the road - again very friendly but insubstantial (coffee and pastry) given the claim of offering bed and breakfast. So in the end, despite a great time, we thought it was overpriced for what we actually got.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: philcab
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a week in March. We are a family of five, that is two adults and three children ages 6, 8, and 10. We booked the quad room with the understanding that we could put the five of us in that room. It worked out quite well. The room had a queen bed and two single beds. Rather than squeeze us into the available bedding, we brought a sleeping bag with us and the kids loved taking turns sleeping in it. The room was sparkling clean as was the bathroom. The shower was fabulous with a rain shower head. Flat screen TV and laptop all worked out great. Minibar, safe, soap, shampoo, hair dryer, and daily maid service all included. The lobby has a 24 hour cofffee/tea machine as well as larger refrigerator and sink. The lobby is up on the first floor of the building with all of the rooms coming right off of the lobby. The location is fabulous. From the airport, we took the train to the Trastevere station and then the tram which took us within two blocks of the hotel. If we did this with three children anybody could do it!! From the hotel, you can take the tram and be in the center of town in five minutes!!!! Make sure you get the METROCARD when you are there for unlimited bus/tram/metro service. The down side would clearly be the noise. The outside noise of motorcycles, construction, churchbells and people seemed to be neverending. We did not experience any noise from within the hotel itself, just from outside. Also, the breakfast was a little underwhelming especially with three growing children: a hot drink, a cold drink, and a pastry. The front desk staff is present mostly from 8AM to 5PM but it works out well making you feel like you are in your own apt at night. We would definitely stay again. By the way, bring lots of money - you will go broke on meals.

Reviews.Title: “A fantastic place to stay”
Reviews.Author: bookgirl76
Reviews.Content: We stayed at WHR Trastevere over the Thanksgiving holiday and had a wonderful time. It's a great alternative to larger hotels, and if you're looking for something quieter and more laid back, this is a great choice. The staff is great. Franco was very helpful and accomodating. The location is great--far enough away from major attractions so it's quiet, but close enough to walk. The neighborhood is charming and filled with wonderful bars and restaurants. Check out the open air market in the neighborhood--it's wonderful! The room was large, clean, and very comfortable. The bathrooms had all new fixtures, and the shower had plenty of hot water. Since the building is on a side street, we also found the room to be very quiet. The laptop in the room was great for looking up travel information and navigating the city. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Roman accommdation”
Reviews.Author: jen053
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the WRH Trastevere Hotel at Via di San Crisogno, 40 in Rome. This hotel was unexpectedly fantastic. My husband and I were at the end of a 2 month trip and this was without doubt the best room we had on the entire trip. The room was spacious, immaculate and surprisingly modern. The bathroom was amazing. The location couldn't have been better, near all the hot spots in Rome. Finally, Franco was extremely helpful and lovely to deal with. I can't recommend this hotel highly enough.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful room, wonderful location, wonderful time”
Reviews.Author: Matthias_K
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the WRH Trastevere for 5 nights and had a wonderful time! The hotel is perfectly located for sightseeing trips as well as going out for dinner in the evening. The staff was extremely helpfull and gave advise for restaurants. The rooms were spotless clean! The laptop in the room was a great help for checking eMails or the wether for the next days

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff! Incredible Location!!”
Reviews.Author: JoeyFromTheBlock
Reviews.Content: I LOVED this bed and breakfast! i was new to Rome and I needed a place to stay in the fun Trastevere area. I stopped by the WRH and was immediately captured by the fun, funky, stylish decor. If that were not enough... the staff could NOT be more kind and helpful! I live in Trastevere now and I feel it is important to mention that the location for this B and B is EXCELLENT. There are very few accommodations for travelers in this great area. This is head and shoulders above the rest!

Reviews.Title: “Adorable room!”
Reviews.Author: sscalzo
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 3 nights at the beginning of our trip and then a final night before we flew out of Rome. Our room was a comfortable size, nice beds, and neatly decorated. The bathroom was small (but not horrible) and very clean. The staff was so very friendly, spoke English very well, and were willing to help out in terms of finding what was in the area. The hotel was centrally located to cab stands, the tram, and bus stops. I like the fact that there were only 5 rooms. Our only complaint was that the walls were thin and at times, we could hear entire conversations of the fellow guests. I would most certainly book a room there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff... Sucky Internet- Not Mac Friendly”
Reviews.Author: travelanddesign
Reviews.Content: Franco the manager was great, very very helpful and genuinely interested in our comfort. The room was cool, but if you are travelling with someone you're not audibly or visually "bathroom-comfortable" with you know, new gf, or bf... then definitely don't stay in the room with the clear glass bathroom door. I stayed with my husband and still it was a little... intimate. : ) We had a round bed which I loved. The shower was nice, a bit small, but the doorknob fell off. Bathroom too. The area is way cool. Feels more like you are living in a tiny cool apartment. The free internet was nice, but the computer kept crashing, and our MACS don't work on their wifi. They need a better router, like an Airport, to accommodate us mac users. Otherwise it would have been perfect!

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: george_cy
Reviews.Content: Excellent room. Excellent position. Great value for money. Excellent service, the personnel were more than great. At first, I was very reluctant when I learned that there was no reception after 5pm but when I got there I had never felt unsecure. There is no bar or restaurant they only serve breakfast but someone can find all these in walking distance. If what you are looking for is The room had private laptop with wi-fi and satellite tv. These amenities were included in the price. Stayed there for 14 nights at a very reasonable rate and loved the place. I would definately stay there again If I ever visit Rome again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: shrimper7
Reviews.Content: Stayed with my sons for 8 nights in August 2007. Good location - excellent restaurants close by - 10/15 min walk to metro but trams closeby. Rooms very comfortable and kept very clean. Franco and staff were always ready to help. Having a laptop PC and a modern TV where we played back the camcorder was handy too. Would recommend and would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “A little oasis”
Reviews.Author: barkingfish
Reviews.Content: It's slightly out of the centre but everywhere is very easily reached on foot or by bus, tram or taxi. The streetlife and nightlife of the area is more Roman and laid back and definitely preferable to the tourist hubs - people are actually having fun instead of just ticking the "been there" box. The hotel itself is very clean, modern and uncluttered which is a nice contrast after being out all day in busy old streets. The laptop and internet in the room were very useful and the staff were very helpful and friendly. I wouldn't hesitate stay again on another visit to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Good base for first time visit to Rome”
Reviews.Author: megablst
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for our first time in Rome - with a view to doing all the tourist stuff. First thing, this place is difficult to find. Even the taxi driver was struggling. It's just a small door on the side an anonymous building. We got the train to travestre station (from the airport) and then a taxi. Make sure you have your google maps with you before you depart so you can find it. Once there, it's on the 1st floor, a large 5 room apartment converted into a 5 room hotel. Inside, quite ikea-ish, generally all showers etc very modern and above all clean. Our room had a rather unfortunate misted glass door between the on suite toilet and the bedroom but not a major issue. The shower was excellent. I'd describe it as value for money. A laptop with wireless in the room was invaluable. I just wish this was standard practice! Breakfast was disappointing considering you're in Rome with great food everywhere. The main thing though is the location. Perfect for getting around Rome for first timers, easy to find in the evening (once you know where it is!). We experienced a little noise on the Saturday night but it wouldn't stop me staying again. Okay for a 2-3 day stay where the focus is not luxiorious hotel / but a value for money approach with a focus on seeing Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, modern and affordable mini-hotel in Rome (170 euros)”
Reviews.Author: Polarbjorn
Reviews.Content: The rooms can be a little ikea-ish and our room (3) had an unfortunate transparent toilet partition and a round bed. Great Rome location, walkable to the historic center. It's first floor location can mean some street noise at night. The breakfast of toast & marmalade was slim and disappointing for such a country of fresh food. Free wireless internet with a laptop in every room was a nice extra.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel fab location!”
Reviews.Author: KSCheshire
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 2 nights during a trip to Italy, the hotel is in an excellent location, the Trastevere in my opinion is the best area to stay in Rome, no more than 10 mins walk into the centre but in the best area for food and Italian nightlife, it is away from the busy and often tacky tourist areas. Franco was really welcoming when we arrived and throughout our stay I felt nothing was too much trouble. We took advantage on an offer to upgrade our room to the superior double which I would really recommend. The room was really large with a lovely bathroom. Big wardrobe space and a safe. One of the best features was the free internet access via the laptop provided in your room, this was really handy for looking up things to see and do. As a tip if you pay your bill in cash you may get a small discount. Also you can easily get a local train from the airport and then the number 8 tram to the hotel (if you e-mail the hotel before you go they will send you full instructions) it is a very cheap way of getting from the airport and in total takes about an hour. I will definately be staying here again!

Reviews.Title: “Great location! Nice hotel!”
Reviews.Author: MenB
Reviews.Content: Our (5-day) stay at WRH Trastevere was very pleasant. Although there wasn't much closet space, the room was very nice, modern and quite big. The bathroom was also modern and spacious with a very nice rainforrest-shower. But the best thing about this hotel was it's great location. Trastevere is very quiet and calm in the daytime. But in the evening it is a very lively and great place to be for people of all ages. The last two weeks of July are especially a great time to be in Trastevere. Every night there are all sorts of festivities and the streets are swamped with people/residents of all ages. Don't forget to go to Piazza Santa Maria in the heart of Trastevere. This square is a great place to drink some wine/beer while you sit on the steps of the fountain (that stands in the middle of the square) and watch all kinds of musicians and streetartists perform.

Reviews.Title: “Great bed and breakfast”
Reviews.Author: DublinTerry
Reviews.Content: The bed and breakfast is on the first floor of a very ordinary looking building but inside is a very different story. The decor is very modern and each room is quite individual in style. The air conditioned room was very comfortable. I enjoyed having broadband available in the room - great for checking out out the Roman sites on line. The breakfast was continental and nice but no fresh bread. There was a friendly atmosphere among the guests and staff. Franco, the main staff contact, was extremely helpful and witty. He was able to give us good advice about where to eat and getting from place to place on tram or bus. It is a very short walk to the number 8 tram and the H bus from WRF. We found lots of reasonably priced places to eat nearby and there is an ice cream parlor just around the corner. All in all a very good place to stay during your visit to Rome.

HotelInfo.Name: WRH Trastevere
HotelInfo.Address: Via San Crisogono 40, 00153 Rome, Italy
